nodes.text: [You wake up in a unfamiliar jungle. As you look around, you can see the Earth in the sky and alien creatures roaming around. Last you remember, you were on your spaceship. After looking around, it looks like we have two ways forward.]

choices.text: Continue down path ahead. It looks clear and easy to walk through.
Veer off the path. There are strange plants scattered throughout the jungle.

nodes.text: [As you continue down the path, you notice a split in the road.]

choices.text: Down the left path, you see a small camp. There may be some food and gear you can grab from the locals. However, they may be hostile.
You hear a rustling coming from the right. What could it be?

nodes.text: [You were never one to take the easy path. But now you are getting lost in the trees and wildlife.]

choices.text: OW! You stepped on a thorny plant. You have now taken poison damage. You passed out.
What's that strange noise? You head towards the noise

nodes.text: [After reaching the camp, you find that the locals are curious but friendly. They provide you with food and shelter. After asking about your ship, they don't know about it, but recommend going into the town to ask. However, the locals speak of a 'evil creature' that roams the planet and to avoid it at all costs]

choices.text: Stay in the camp, rest, and gather additional information.
Immediately leave the camp, going towards the shortest path towards the town

nodes.text: [You choose to walk towards the rustling. Your stomach start to churn as you notice dead creatures scattered across this path. You start to think, 'Did I choose correctly?' As you continue down the path, a dark creature jumps out of the jungle. You are frightened and fall back.]

choices.text: Get back up and confront the creature.

nodes.text: [After waking up, you continue your journey through the jungle and find a ravaged camp. It looks like they may have been attacked. You were able to rummage through the chests and fuel up.]

choices.text: You notice a corpse gripping a book with a strange drawing on the cover. Stay in the camp and continue to rummage through the campsite?
Leave the camp. We need to get to our ship as soon as possible. You walk away the camp, down the road.

nodes.text: [As you walk towards the noise, a small creature latches onto your leg. You try kicking it off of you and it took a chunk of your leg with it.]

choices.text: You made so much noise, that it attracted another, much bigger monster. You hear fluttering wings in the distance.

nodes.text: [After staying at the camp and talking to different camp members, you learn that this creature has bad eye sight and is easy to avoid by being quiet. Additionally, the longer path to the town is a lot safer. You go to bed and wake up in the morning.]

choices.text: Now well rested and fed, you continue on your journey down the recommended path.

nodes.text: [You loot the chests, however, you notice a corpse gripping a book with a strange drawing on the cover. ]

choices.text: You muster the courage to pry the book off the corpse. The corpse's arm falls off as you do so.
You decide to leave the corpse alone. You continue your search but find nothing else. You venture forward toward the first path ahead.

nodes.text: [After prying the book off the corpse, you look through it, and find some lore about an evil beast that roams the lands. You learn that there is a creature that has horrible eye sight but great hearing.]

choices.text: You keep this information in mind as you go forward down the first path ahead

nodes.text: [A massive insectoid creature—8 feet tall with glowing red eyes—emerges from the foliage. Its wings buzz like thunder. It's the first boss.]

choices.text: Grab a bone from the ground and fight.
Run toward the glowing cave

nodes.text: [How are you going to do with your weapon?]

choices.text: Aim for its legs
Dodge and aim for the wings

nodes.text: [You shatter a leg—but the creature impales you instantly. Ending: DEAD]
[You cripple its flight but are badly hurt. Believing you dead, the creature leaves. You black out. When you wake, you’re in a bed in a small town, saved by someone unknown. Ending: Reach town]

choices.text: Press 1 to continue

nodes.text: [Which path to take?]

choices.text: Take the left path
Take the right path

nodes.text: [A cloud of shimmering spores bursts around you. You stumble and collapse, overcome by vivid hallucinations of your home planet… forever. DEAD]

[You follow a dim corridor to a clearing where a glowing plant and a stone pedestal await. A relic hums within. As you take it, the cave splits: one path echoes with dripping water, the other glows with warm, vine-covered walls.]

choices.text: Follow the sound of water
Follow the glowing vines

nodes.text: [You emerge from the cave and stumble upon a mysterious alien town. Strange eyes watch you from the shadows. Ending: Reached Town]

choices.text: Press 1 to continue

nodes.text: [The vines wrap tighter around you the deeper you go. Suddenly, the ground gives way—you fall into a pit of writhing roots and vanish into the dark. Ending: DEAD]

choices.text: You steal back your satchel and slip out of the tavern quietly

choices.text: You let her go. At least you got some information.

nodes.text: You leave the town.

choices.text: You leave the town.

nodes.text: As you head out toward the ravine in search of the legendary armorer, a grizzled hunter calls out to you. 'You don’t want to face the Beast alone. I’m Brant. Been chasing her for years. I saw you in the tavern — you’ve got guts. What do you say? Team up?'

choices.text: Stick to the original plan — go find the armorer and the silent boots.
Join forces with Brant and fight the Beast together.

nodes.text: You thank Brant but decide to press on toward the ravine. It's getting dark — if you don’t hurry, the Beast might take your ship for good.

choices.text: You always were a bit of a lone wolf, as you make your way to the armorer, if they even exist, you come across a wide ravine

Brant tries to urge you to reconsider, he's seen this beast many times, he rolls back his sleeve to show a large scar that has long since healed, remnants of a terrifying encounter 'You'll need me, trust me'

nodes.text: You rely on Brant's tracking skills to lead you through the treacherous jungle to the beast, you and Brant both begin to feel nervous, but you can both tell its something beyond just the beast ahead of you, and you aren't sure why

choices.text: You and Brant come up with a plant to lay a trap for the beast
You tell Brant to distract the beast while you go for the heart with your knife 'You ready?' Brant asks you with a smug look on his face. This must be fun for him

nodes.text: 'as you both creep closer, you both make your best attempts at silence while you get closer to set up the trap, you hear a branch snap and look down in horror to see it came from just beneath your foot.

choices.text: Take the boots and climb out.

nodes.text: You emerge, boots snug and soundless. You're ready to face the Beast — quietly.

YOUR SHIP?? Oh Bertha, gotta go after it now! danger is your middle name
